title: Drawing, "Entablature in Classical Style", ca. 1770–90
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and blue, brown, and gray wash, slight traces of graphite on white laid paper
inscribed: Numbered at upper right in pen and black ink: 91
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Depiction of a left corner fragment of an entablature, partially overgrown with plants, featuring a banded frieze with rinceaux and dragon motifs upon a blue ground.

exhibitions.title: Excavating Design: 18th-century Drawings and Prints from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Entablature in Classical Style", ca. 1770–90.
ca. 1770–90. Pen and black ink, brush and blue, brown, and gray wash, slight traces of graphite on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4600.
